properties.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued February 2 at 8:15AM PST until February 2 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
properties.description:
...Dense Fog in Sacramento Area this Morning and Gusty Northerly
Winds across the Valley Today...

.Areas of dense fog have formed in the Sacramento metro area,
creating travel impacts from low visibilities. A strong upper
trough moving through today will bring a period of gusty
northerly winds. Expected wind gusts are likely to reach 30 to 45
mph at times from the late morning through the evening. Breezy
conditions to continue into Monday as the system exits toward the
southwestern U.S.

* WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility below one quarter
mile in dense fog. For the Wind Advisory, northerly winds 20 to
30 mph with gusts up to 30 to 40 mph expected.

* WHERE...Southern Sacramento Valley around Sacramento metro area.

* WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until noon PST today. For
the Wind Advisory, until 7 PM PST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.
Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
result. Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Roads impacted include, but not limited
to Interstate 80, Highway 50, Highway 99 and Interstate 5.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

If driving, slow down, use your headlights, leave plenty of
distance ahead of you, and be prepared for sudden changes in
visibility.

NWSheadline: DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING
